Slipped on the send button, sorry about the last post.

Most people pick up=
 mocks to test a system in isolation from external
resources. I've been mor=
e successful when using them to test classes in
isolation from other classe=
s.

I also found that dynamic mock frameworks work very poorly when used
"t=
est-after". I think of mocks mainly as a design-tool. If you're not
interes=
ted in the design-aid mocks provide then in my experience they will
provide=
 very little value for you.

Just my opinion, not the rules :)
/J
